definition:
1. Flowing to; flowing abundantly. "Affluent blood." Harvey. 2. Abundant; copious; plenteous; hence, wealthy; abounding in goods or riches. Language . . . affluent in expression. H. Reed. Loaded and blest with all the affluent store, Which human vows at smoking shrines implore. Prior.

A stream or river flowing into a larger river or into a lake; a tributary stream.
